Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial on Remote Expert Instructional Feedback in Endovascular Simulation-Based Education

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants, ranging from second to seventh year of residency, were randomly assigned to two groups.

Participants.evidence: The study was conducted at the RCSI Simulation Centre, involving 12 vascular surgery residents in Ireland.

Intervention.evidence: Group 1 received in-person feedback first, followed by remote feedback, while Group 2 received remote feedback first, followed by in-person feedback.

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial investigates the effectiveness of remote expert instructional feedback in endovascular simulation-based education for vascular surgery residents, aiming to enhance training opportunities.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the effectiveness of remote feedback, assessed through interviews and a validated questionnaire post-training.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants, ranging from second to seventh year of residency, were randomly assigned to two groups.

Number_Randomised.evidence: involving 12 vascular surgery residents in Ireland.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference was found between remote and in-person feedback in the questionnaire results.
